website_summaries.verdict: Works with many types of regular sized nuts. Plastic grips make this nut cracker comfortable to hold.
pros: Uses an attached shield to limit scattering of shell pieces
Small device that's easy to store in a drawer
Cracker takes a little while to learn to use efficiently, but it's worth the effort
Will also work to crack shellfish
cons: Often breaks nuts into fragments, rather than halves

customer_reviews.title: Best nut cracker ever
customer_reviews.text: Never had a pecan tree until we moved 1 year ago. Needed a nutcracker so did my research and found the Texan nut sheller. This thing is awesome! 1st time using it and I shelled about 1/3 Whole pecans and 2/3 half (with a few that didn't make it... had to eat those!) Just look at the results! Id recommend this nutcracker to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: AttitudeIsEverything

customer_reviews.title: Never used any better!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast! It snips through our native Texan & cultivated ("improved"?) pecans with ease, and I do NOT have strong hands! I seriously can't wait for the next warm day, envisioning a glass of something cold, warm sun on my poor winter-white legs, and a bucket of pecans at my feet and a big bowl in my lap. This invention is seriously "sliced bread" territory. I almost detracted a star for the "made in China" designation, but at the end of the day, just couldn't do it. It's a fantastic product.
customer_reviews.author: Shanagan

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: I never used these before and was hesitant to buy but they definitely do the job. I bought 10 lbs. of pecans last fall and my old nut cracker wasn’t going to cut it. These did a very good job once I got the hang of it. Approximately 3/4ths came out in with the halves intact. I found if you snip off the ends, then gently crack all over the remaining shell, I got good, consistent results.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne

customer_reviews.title: Broken item
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a couple of these items, while I was using it it broke. I thought it was pretty strong and sturdy but it broke. I want a refund or replacement. This is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: I used this item for the first time this week and it completely fell apart before I got less than a quart of my pecans shelled. I want a replacement
customer_reviews.author: Jeanie Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly EASY for Pecans!
customer_reviews.text: I only crack PECANS. This tool allows you to EASILY nip off each of the ends, lightly crack the shell and the WHOLE NUT just falls out. I cant be more happy with this purchase. I have been reading reviews, watching videos etc. Seems like no one has ever cracked a nut before. They made it look hard and I purchased this with Low expectations. Well, I am blown away. Highly Recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: The cracker gets cracked
customer_reviews.text: Oh yeah, these are great. The first pecan I tried to crack, cracked the cracker in half.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Works!!!
customer_reviews.text: I grew up using this nut cracker but decided to look around to see if there was anything better to shell pecans with. My husband has a cracker that hits the nuts and breaks them that we thought was pretty good, but this sheller is faster. After reading all the reviews and looking at other options we decided that the old tried and true Texas nut cracker is still the way to go. Not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: leftyjewel

customer_reviews.title: Works well, with practice
customer_reviews.text: It works great. We have moved to a home surrounded by pecan trees, and they are starting to produce. This isn't necessarily the most efficient nutcracker, but, depending on the nut (each one is different), it may be the only one that works. One does need to be aware of how sharp the blades are. It is real easy to nick a finger--believe me, I know! It does take some practice, but that is true of any kind of nutcracker.
customer_reviews.author: Ron J

customer_reviews.title: This nutcracker cracked.
customer_reviews.text: Broke during the second session of cracking pecans. Worked great before the break. You can see the metal is full of bubbles.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Good quality endures
customer_reviews.text: I have an early York "Texan" nut cracker/sheller in its original packaging. Price is $3.95 printed on the box, priced before bar codes were used. With the exception of two changes the older one is identical to the new. A company that has been in business making the same quality items for over 40 years must be doing something right.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Would advise not to buy
customer_reviews.text: Does not work well. You need to be very careful not to get cut on the teeth!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa waltersAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The very best nutcracker out there...
customer_reviews.text: As long as you learn how to use it properly, that is. Follow the instructions to nip the ends of the shells first, and then break off the sides slowly, and you will get nice, whole nuts from each shelling. Works well for pecans, walnuts, almonds, hazelnuts, and even brazil nuts (although they are still much harder to extract from the broken shell, and require a pick).
customer_reviews.author: K-

customer_reviews.title: Could be built better in my experience.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the first 10-15 pecans. Then the one scew that holds everything together comes loose and falls out. It won't stay tight. I tightened it over and over and over again but no luck. Perhaps I got a defective one. But when it does work, it works great. Hopefully the seller can send me a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Matt c

customer_reviews.title: Ouch
customer_reviews.text: Don’t get your fingers in the way sliced my finger open
customer_reviews.author: willaim karnes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit. Exactly as ordered.
customer_reviews.text: Not quite as good as the older one. Does not grab the entire pecan. The older one has a rounded bar holding the teeth. This one has the teeth straight across. Requires more steps to the shelling. Sturdy product.
customer_reviews.author: gloria mason

customer_reviews.title: I am from pecan growing part of Texas and during ...
customer_reviews.text: I am from pecan growing part of Texas and during my life I have used about every type cracker. this is a cutter, an as I was growing up I learned to cut pecans with a pocket knife. this took a sharp knife and strong hands. I give pecans and a cutter for gifts with the promise I get the shells back and I use them in my smoker
customer_reviews.author: cooker John

customer_reviews.title: A rock would do better
customer_reviews.text: Fell apart after a few uses. We only used it on pecans. It would have broken on the first use on a harder shelled nut. I don't recommend it. Go get a rock from outside to use. It will do a better job and last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Tallman

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart
customer_reviews.text: Worst purchase I have made. It fell apart within a couple days of light use. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The BEST nut sheller
customer_reviews.text: Love this nut sheller. Very easy to use and the grip with the handles is good for those of us who have weak hands. This is the nut sheller my local pecan retailer provides so that the customer can try the pecans. I was so glad I found it. It's worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Hariett Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, but pay attention when using
customer_reviews.text: It's basically pliers with cutting blades on the jaws so it works fine. But since it's basically pliers with cutting blades on the jaws, it can be dangerous if one doesn't pay attention when using it...and IMO keep it away from children.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Efficient opener for harder shell nuts
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for pistachios but it's a bit too efficient (crushed nuts if not carefully used). My mother used to have one just like this, and it was great for pecans. Maybe for almonds, walnuts, whatever also.
customer_reviews.author: Gail W Mallory

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS NUT SHELLER
customer_reviews.text: I have a pecan farm and I need something to test my pecans at the end of the year, this is amazing, it cracks the pecans and I get the whole heart all the time, I love it and it is the only one I use.
customer_reviews.author: PMTZ

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: This product is not well made. The jaw blades started bending under use on pecans. We have a 50 year old one that still works better than this new one. So disappointed as I wanted to gift my children with one.
customer_reviews.author: TxGal51

customer_reviews.title: great idea but not the best quality
customer_reviews.text: this is my second one. it's a great idea, but I was a bit disappointed when the first one fell apart after several uses. I mean, I don't make a career out of shelling nuts and really thought it would last. wrote a letter to the company, never got an answer. my husband really liked the idea that it keeps the shells contained and bought a replacement. if this one goes, it's back to old faithful, the classic silver. not the best quality, I'm sorry to say.
customer_reviews.author: JudyReene

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and with whole peeled pecan
customer_reviews.text: Best nut sheller for pecan . I have used 3 other different types, but they are all break pecan to small pieces. But this tool is great for ending up with whole or half peeled pecan. Easy to use !
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Not for walnuts
customer_reviews.text: Not for walnuts cannot break them maybe it is made for a smaller nuts
customer_reviews.author: AMER

customer_reviews.title: Good nutcracker
customer_reviews.text: These are the best nut crackers I have ever used. You can nip off the ends and crack the pecan too. Haven’t tried other nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Nelle

customer_reviews.title: Easy.. recommend it
customer_reviews.text: The pecans came not on pieces when you put the right pressure on it. Make me spend less time opening them. Very easy to use. Seems to be durable.
customer_reviews.author: Marel

customer_reviews.title: Great for snipping off the ends of pecans.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Wish the jaws were a bit wider, for smashing the nuts lengthwise. The flats behind the pivot point do okay for that, though. Sharp jaws, be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Tellitlikeitis

customer_reviews.title: Pecan Cracker
customer_reviews.text: This new pecan cracker is great. Cut off ends and it even gets the edges without hurting the pecan.
customer_reviews.author: Melba LaCroix

customer_reviews.title: Extra Sheller for this house
customer_reviews.text: Really like this sheller, I have one of the older models and the cover is just a bit different from the orignal one. The jaws work really good. I haven't used another sheller that I like better than this one, this is why I bought me a extra one and one for my friend. This newer one has the rubber handles that my older one doesn't, that is an improvement on the product. The seller was every effecient in the shipping and no problems what so ever with doing business with this company.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lara

customer_reviews.title: nut shelling device deluxe
customer_reviews.text: this device is quick and easy to use. doesn't matter if you are left or right hand dominant it works well with either 3 clips on most nuts will do the job
customer_reviews.author: charles hickman

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect tool for shelling pecans. I acquired a huge supply of pecans from a relative whose hobby seems to be picking them up from under every tree she can find. Shelling with a standard nut cracker was tedious and imperfect until I came across this little gem of a tool. Got through those gallons of pecans in no time, and they came out of the shell in big pieces, even entire halves. Well worth the money if you are doing a big shelling job.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Doolittle

customer_reviews.title: Works and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This unique cracker allows you to crack pecans and get almost perfect halves. My husband was using a regular hand one and was breaking it all into tiny pieces and once he got this he doubled his production rate and quality of nuts. We love to pick up handfuls of nuts from trees and just crack and eat them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Pecan Sheller period!!
customer_reviews.text: Only reason I am buying another, is I lost the last one... Just wish they were made in the USA Don't know why they advertised such a long lead time, I received mine in two days.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Easy Pecan
customer_reviews.text: The best cracker for native pecan. Clip the ends then pop the middle. Woo Lah.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Nuts come out whole. It's great!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely great! Gets into nuts without chewing up the nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Julianna Neighbors

customer_reviews.title: The best pecan cracker I have ever used!
customer_reviews.text: This pecan shell cracker not only does an excellent job of cracking the shells, but also allows for getting many more pecan halves! A great time saver! As soon as you snip off one end of the shell, you can instantly see if the pecan is worth cracking, or not. No more do I have to crack the shell open to see if the pecan meat is good or bad. There may be better pecan shell crackers out there, but I have not seen them!
customer_reviews.author: EttuBrute

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I like that the handles give you a good grip. If you have weak hands, this tool will crack nuts using little pressure...hapy i purchased this one instead of some of the other models.
customer_reviews.author: pnash

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Effective, if a bit Awkward on Smaller Nuts
customer_reviews.text: It's a handy tool for nuts that are hard to open by hand. It's a bit awkward (or should I say dangerous to fingers) on smaller nuts (like pistachios that were not cracked for hand-opening). Seems like decent construction. They say you can move the shield to facilitate left-handed use, but we have not tried that. The serrated jaws grip nuts pretty well to avoid slipping.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Sailor

customer_reviews.title: Best in Texas
customer_reviews.text: I learned how to use these at about years old and I'm 68 . I reccomend them highly to everybody
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: When only the BEST will do!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down, this is the VERY best method for shelling pecans I have ever found! If you want PERFECT halves every time, there simply is NO other sheller on the market that even comes close. No matter whether you're a professional grower or a once-a-year Christmas nut enthusiast, you will LOVE this sheller. Check out You Tube to see how EASY this is to use!
customer_reviews.author: amborider

customer_reviews.title: Bed to find instructions before use. Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: Once I found a video on how to use it, I went through pounds of pecans easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ease of Performance
customer_reviews.text: Better design than a very old one in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: art

customer_reviews.title: Great product !
customer_reviews.text: It was really easy to use but I’m confused on what it means to flip the blue cover.
customer_reviews.author: Stephenie Gillen

customer_reviews.title: Pecans and soft shells only
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine on pecans but shatters walnuts. Became loose after a few days. Can be a real knuckle buster.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Whiting

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I had read other reviews that this nut sheller was dangerous, but haven't had any problems after cracking about 7 lbs of pecans (both hard and paper shell). Would highly recommend, about 90% success at getting intact pecan halves.
customer_reviews.author: Graham

customer_reviews.title: Good product for Average nuts
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for black walnuts and it isn’t strong enough for that type of nut; however, I feel it would work well for English walnuts and other less sturdy shells.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey B. Burton

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Makes cracking the pecans easier. Still time consuming and you have to practice at it but overall I’m glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Belinda Cortez

customer_reviews.title: Best we tried for pecans
customer_reviews.text: This is the best one we tried for shelling pecans and keeping the nut halves intact. Others work to crack the shell but crush the nut meat no matter how careful.
customer_reviews.author: Cydney C. Fowler

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR PECANS!
customer_reviews.text: This style nut sheller is not easy to find! I was delighted to find it on Amazon. It is perfect for shelling pecans! Just keep the screws tightened and you will love it!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tool that saves the Fingers
customer_reviews.text: Love that this is the tool for the job. Be patient it will take a few dozen pecans to get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: Derrellene Zbikowski

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Alternative
customer_reviews.text: Once you learn to use it properly, it takes only a few snips the ends to open a nut and get the unbroken meat (most of the time), This is the way I have seen squirrels and chipmunks open a nut. Works well on almonds, filberts, pecans and walnuts. Brazil nuts are a little more challenging, but doable with a little practice.
customer_reviews.author: William Weber

customer_reviews.title: Nut crusher not cracker
customer_reviews.text: does not work as expected - does not catch all nut pieces and mostly crushes the nut versus cutting it
customer_reviews.author: shine1sun

customer_reviews.title: pecans and more pecans
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend who has 3 huge old pecan trees in his front yard. He spends evenings watching TV, drinking beer and shelling pecans with his buddies. Much better than the hammer they were using on the wood coffee table:( Anyway the boys love it and think I am the bomb ever since I delivered this to him. So 5 stars for this one!
customer_reviews.author: Stacy H.

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best pecan sheller
customer_reviews.text: The BEST pecan sheller on the market! Hands down! With this I can shell a pecan in 20 seconds. And the pecan comes out whole...not in pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect pecan sheller in my opinion. I have tried many others and this one is the only one where you can consistently turn out perfect pecan halves!
customer_reviews.author: Poppy H

customer_reviews.title: ... purchased several pecan nut crackers to see which works best and this one performed the best in giving me ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased several pecan nut crackers to see which works best and this one performed the best in giving me more whole pieces of pecans.
customer_reviews.author: Echoman007

customer_reviews.title: I was very pleased to find this nut sheller
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these from years back that somehow disappeared perhaps with one of the many AWOL sock singles. I was very pleased to find this nut sheller. It works perfectly on the paper shell as well as the tiny hard as rock native pecans. The shield is plastic instead of metal like on my prior model, but the teeth are equally sharp and it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Cooper

customer_reviews.title: You need to know what kind of pecan you have before you buy this!
customer_reviews.text: If your tree produces soft shell pecans, you are going to love this Sheller. However is your tree produces Hard Shell or Native Pecans, you will Hate this and think this is one of the worst products you have ever used. I have both type of trees and on the soft or paper shell pecans, this can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: 76Tiger

customer_reviews.title: Precision Cracker Favored by Texans
customer_reviews.text: Where I live, near Texas, this is the sheller the locals use. Impact crackers are good too, but these shellers are preferred in these parts by many. This is a well made one with precision action.
customer_reviews.author: Miep Rowan O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Best nutcracker.
customer_reviews.text: My father-in-law always kept this kind of nut cracker and my husband got his pair. These were used until they fell apart. It was great to find this kind of nut cracker here and the tradition lives on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best style for pecans.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for pecans. It was one of the only one that doesn't break the nut. I will let you know about durability after I try it.
customer_reviews.author: Janiske

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Its nothing fancy or cute like a squirrel nut sheller, but this feels to be really high quality metal with nice grips. It has a cap that you can move to make it easier for right handed people, or left handed people. Easily broke through the pecan shells I was breaking through. I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Robert B

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well-made
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for the Holiday Season so haven't tried it out. But it sure looks sturdy and well-made. I'm confident it will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid G.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I have tried others and this one has been the best I've found.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Not crazy about it.
customer_reviews.text: It's ok, but sort of hard to use plus it does not have close and lock option to it takes up more space in my drawer than it needs to.
customer_reviews.author: Opinionator

customer_reviews.title: My favorite pecan cracker!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and I was able to end up with a lot of whole pecans!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty but cracker., I haven't figured out ...
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty but cracker.,I haven't figured out how to crack pecans using this cracker without damaging the meat so none of my halves remained whole.
customer_reviews.author: Carol S

customer_reviews.title: You need this!
customer_reviews.text: We have a Pecan Tree and thousands of nuts each season. This is the first Nutcracker that makes it much easier and less messy! Over 800 cracked since our purchase and counting!
customer_reviews.author: John Scavetto

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to use and got very good results most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Keep a towel around your work area to collect the small nutshell pieces
customer_reviews.text: It took awhile to feel the right pressure to use, but then it worked very well. Made it substantially easier to get pecan halves, rather than tiny broken pieces. Alittle messy in the work area, but all products sold would be.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: This may take some practice
customer_reviews.text: We are pretty unexperienced in Shelling pecans. The advertisement for this make it look easy. We did manage to use it but struggled a bit. We were also using another Cracker. We got the job done but couldn't give rave reviews to either product. Possibly we just need more practice.
customer_reviews.author: gg

customer_reviews.title: Not a nut cracker, it's a shell cutter!
customer_reviews.text: The best! Once you figure it out, this thing is awesome! The key is to use it properly. Cut the ends off, then turn the nut parrallel (sp?) to the blades. Take a shallow bite of the edge of the shell, squeezing gently until you hear the crack. Turn the nut a bit and squeeze again. Three or four turns, it really only takes a few seconds. Experiment!
customer_reviews.author: flathead

customer_reviews.title: Makes shelling Pecans so much easier!
customer_reviews.text: This product works extremely well. Before using this I had given up on shelling pecans from my grandmothers trees. After buying this shelling pecans is a breeze. I found a video on youtube that explains how to use it much better than the instructions that comes with the sheller.
customer_reviews.author: C Neil

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but didn’t last long, spring broke after a short while
customer_reviews.author: Big G

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are great nut sheller's. I have had several and given a couple away.
customer_reviews.author: Boopsie

customer_reviews.title: Smashed My Pecans
customer_reviews.text: This is the third pecan sheller that I have tried. Still looking for one that I really like.
customer_reviews.author: Jo from Texas

customer_reviews.title: Take your time, don't get in a hurry. 😀
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well after I learned how to use it. A great piece of engineering.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This works great
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 10 lbs of unshelled pecans for cracking. When the pecans arrived size was small and they were hard to shell without breaking up the nut. Husband perferred nut cracker. We don't usually get excited to receive a tool but this is the exception.
customer_reviews.author: MiMi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pecan Sheller!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent nut cracker, very sharp, be careful...my nine year thought he could use these I was very concerned that he could injure himself. These definitely do the job but can be quite messy!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Loftis

customer_reviews.title: This is my favorite design for shelling pecans
customer_reviews.text: Overall This is my favorite design for shelling pecans. For other nuts another design may be better but this is very good for pecans in particular. Construction seems very solid so I don't foresee any no problems. Have used for several months so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jethro

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Keep your finger tips clear of the gater teeth. This sucker bites. It works well.
customer_reviews.author: Elton T

customer_reviews.title: worked better than any other kind of nut cracker for pecans
customer_reviews.text: A little awkward to use at first, but once i got the hang of it, worked better than any other kind of nut cracker for pecans.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn A. Long

customer_reviews.title: Still working!
customer_reviews.text: Still working on last bag of pecans for this year. Replacing one that wore out after three years. Should have included extra blades.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Its alot easier to crack pecans with this than all the other crackers. You get whole pecans with this all the other one give you pecan pieces
customer_reviews.author: robert villarreal

customer_reviews.title: Bought Two
customer_reviews.text: I found this easy to use and study enough to stand up to the pecans supplied by the 17 pecan trees in my parents yard. I liked it so much that I bought my parents one too.
customer_reviews.author: Danyale S.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This works great! It is super easy to use. I am glad I bought it. I'll sit down and crack open pecans and bag them, super easy great quality.
customer_reviews.author: wellversed

customer_reviews.title: Does not leave shells all over the place like the rubber band one
customer_reviews.text: Old tried and tool. Remembering using one of these as a kid. Does not leave shells all over the place like the rubber band one.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Quality  of item
customer_reviews.text: I was familiar with the York Texas Nutcracker and knew it to be a quality item. It's great, y'all should advertise it and increase your sales! Faye Braswell
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth Bach

customer_reviews.title: Does a fantastic job!
customer_reviews.text: There is a pecan grove not far from my home, where the owners let passers-by gather as many pecans as they want. But they still need to be shelled. This device came well recommended and works like a charm! Easy to use and highly effective!
customer_reviews.author: T. Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: The Texan York Nut Sheller was exactly as I expected ...
customer_reviews.text: The Texan York Nut Sheller was exactly as I expected (it was replacement of identical sheller that was used successfully for many years (the cutting blades just got dull)
customer_reviews.author: Doris Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Jaws nutcracker for whole nut pieces as a result
customer_reviews.text: This nutcracker works stellar with pecans and other nuts of similar hardness and size. It is not quite as sturdy as the ones my uncle had years ago, but works well and appears to have replacable jaws for cracking. Thus far it has worked really well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Texan Nut Sheller 00001 The Texan York Nutsheller
customer_reviews.text: Rating is excellent. This product does an excellent job in cutting off the ends of the nut shells and makes it very easy to get most of the meat of the nuts out of the shell in one piece. The quality of the product is very good and should last a long time. We would recommend this product to anyone who shells nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer r.a.wilcoxso

customer_reviews.title: You better buy two in case one breaks
customer_reviews.text: Not near the weight of the 30 year old one I still have. You better buy two in case one breaks.

customer_reviews.text: it cracked the nut in half, but did not help to get the hickory nut meat out

customer_reviews.title: Best Cracker
customer_reviews.text: If you want whole nuts, this is the fastest and easiest way to do it by hand.

customer_reviews.title: All cracked up.
customer_reviews.text: It takes a little practice, but it sure is better than any other kind of nutcracker I have tried. Pecan nuts are delicate while the shells are very durable. I like that I can order replacement blades.

customer_reviews.title: This be a good cracker.
customer_reviews.text: It does good cracking English walnuts. Be careful of your fingers. I nicked one but only slightly.

product_meta.title: Texan Nut Sheller 00001 The Texan York Sheller-Nut Cracker
product_meta.description: Color:-Immortality in a shell For over 780,000 years, humans have been craving and eating nuts. While it may not be the very first recorded food item in the history of humankind, man has been eating nuts for as long as he has been able to find them. Almonds, pecans, acorns, pistachios and all manner of treasures with tough shells have been put into our dishes or eaten as a dish for a very long time – it’s tradition. For as long as this has been true, these hundreds of thousands of years, man has developed tools in order to get to the crunchy center of each delicious nut. Initially, these tools were rocks and primitive hammers used to bludgeon open the shell. Later on, they became more advanced and more easy to handle than a sharp stone. Now let’s go back to our own time. Nuts are still a staple food item in our diet – particularly here in the US – and for a good reason. The health benefits of eating these delectable fruits are too many to recount. To name one of the most resounding benefits that usually gets attention – people who regularly eat nuts live on average up to five years longer than those who do not. It’s tradition for a very good reason – even ancient man knew this. The past 782,000 years have brought about a few changes. One of the most important ones is shelling. You no longer have to whack the shell with a jagged rock in order to open it and enjoy the succulent taste of fresh pecans or pistachios – we have the tools to make this significantly easier for you. Nut shellers have been in production for centuries – it’s craftsmanship. Like the nuts themselves, Shellers are a tradition with hundreds of years of history behind them. Different countries have Shellers in different shapes and for different purposes. What these time-tested products have in common is that they’re extremely well-crafted, sturdy and made with the same approach one would take in crafting a masterwork industrial tool.
feature_bullets: SIMPLICITY: The simplest tool for a job is the best. Meet the Texan “York” Nut Sheller, a nut sheller that exudes simplicity
PERFORMANCE & DURABILITY: Tempered steel built for a specific purpose without any embellishments or unnecessary extras
EASY OPEN DESIGN: The design enables you to crack most nuts with ease with a process made much simpler than with most conventional crackers
LITTLE FORCE NEEDED: A simple applying of pressure will do the job without the need for a power socket
ELEGANCE: The Texan York Nut Sheller fulfills your needs - simply and elegantly
